text: This honestly feels like a deal-breaker, :tired_face: please tell me I'm doing something wrong! When the blog author inserts an image into a blog post, they must set the width and height of the image in pixels. These values are put in the element styling of the image, which means that the classes for images I wrote in my blog_post_template are overridden! What is the point of this behavior?
You can add one extra div on top of author img tag and then make a reference class according to your height width and save in your style sheet
